questions.question_text: How many lines of symmetry does an equilateral triangle have?
questions.explanation_correct: An equilateral triangle has 3 equal sides and 3 equal angles. This means it has 3 lines of symmetry, where the triangle can be divided into two equal halves.
questions.explanation_incorrect: An equilateral triangle does not have just 1 or 2 lines of symmetry. It also does not have 0 lines of symmetry. This is because an equilateral triangle has 3 equal sides and 3 equal angles, so it can be divided into 3 equal parts along 3 lines of symmetry.

questions.question_text: Which of the following letters has a vertical line of symmetry?
questions.explanation_correct: The letter 'A' has a vertical line of symmetry. This means that if you draw a vertical line down the center of the letter, the two halves on either side of the line will be identical mirrors of each other.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The letters 'F', 'G', and 'J' do not have a vertical line of symmetry. The letter 'A' is the only one among the options that has a vertical line of symmetry, where the two halves of the letter are identical when divided by a vertical line through the center.

questions.question_text: A rectangle has exactly 2 lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: A rectangle has exactly 2 lines of symmetry because it has two axes of symmetry - one running vertically through the middle, and one running horizontally through the middle. This means the rectangle can be folded in half along these lines and the two halves will match perfectly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A common mistake is to think that a rectangle has more than 2 lines of symmetry. This is not true. A rectangle has only 2 lines of symmetry - one running vertically through the middle, and one running horizontally through the middle. It does not have any other lines of symmetry besides these two.

questions.question_text: A circle has ________ lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: A circle has an infinite number of lines of symmetry because you can draw an unlimited number of lines that go through the center of the circle and divide it into two equal halves. This means a circle has symmetry along every possible line that passes through its center.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer format is 'infinite'. A circle does not have a finite number of lines of symmetry. Instead, a circle has an unlimited or infinite number of lines of symmetry. This is because you can draw an endless number of lines that pass through the center of the circle and divide it into two equal parts.

questions.question_text: Which of the following shapes has NO line of symmetry?
questions.explanation_correct: A scalene triangle has no lines of symmetry because its three sides and three angles are all different lengths and measures. This means there is no way to fold the shape in half and have both halves match exactly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A square, circle, and regular hexagon all have line(s) of symmetry. A square has 4 lines of symmetry, a circle has infinite lines of symmetry, and a regular hexagon has 6 lines of symmetry. However, a scalene triangle, which has 3 sides and 3 angles of different lengths and measures, does not have any lines of symmetry.

questions.question_text: An isosceles triangle has exactly one line of symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: An isosceles triangle has two sides of equal length, which means it has one line of symmetry. This line of symmetry passes through the midpoint of the base and the vertex opposite to it, dividing the triangle into two equal halves.
questions.explanation_incorrect: An isosceles triangle does not have exactly two lines of symmetry. Instead, it has exactly one line of symmetry. This line of symmetry passes through the midpoint of the base and the vertex opposite to it, dividing the triangle into two equal halves.

questions.question_text: A square has ________ lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: A square has 4 lines of symmetry because it is a regular polygon with 4 equal sides and 4 equal angles. Imagine folding a square along any of its four sides - the two halves will match up perfectly, showing that there are 4 lines of symmetry in a square.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer format is '4', which is correct. A square does not have 2 lines of symmetry, as it is a regular polygon with 4 equal sides and 4 equal angles. A square has 4 lines of symmetry, which means you can fold it along any of its four sides and the two halves will match up perfectly.

questions.question_text: Which letter has both horizontal and vertical lines of symmetry?
questions.explanation_correct: The letter 'H' has both horizontal and vertical lines of symmetry. This means that if you fold the letter 'H' along the horizontal or vertical line, the two halves will match perfectly, indicating symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The letter 'D' has only one line of symmetry (vertical), the letter 'B' has only one line of symmetry (vertical), and the letter 'E' has only one line of symmetry (horizontal). Therefore, the letter 'H' is the only option that has both horizontal and vertical lines of symmetry.

questions.question_text: The letter M has a vertical line of symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: The letter M has a vertical line of symmetry because if you fold the letter along the middle, the two halves will match perfectly. This means the letter is symmetric along the vertical line in the middle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The letter M does not have a horizontal line of symmetry. If you try to fold the letter M horizontally, the two halves will not match. This is because the M has a distinctive shape with two diagonal lines on the left and right sides, which makes it asymmetric along the horizontal axis.

questions.question_text: How many lines of symmetry does a regular pentagon have?
questions.explanation_correct: A regular pentagon has 5 equal sides and 5 equal angles. Since it is a regular polygon, it has 5 lines of symmetry, one through each vertex and one through the midpoint of each side.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 5 lines of symmetry. A regular pentagon is a 5-sided shape with all sides and angles equal. It has 5 lines of symmetry, one through each vertex and one through the midpoint of each side. Option A, 3 lines of symmetry, is incorrect because a regular pentagon has more than 3 lines of symmetry. Option B, 4 lines of symmetry, and Option D, 6 lines of symmetry, are also incorrect as they do not match the actual number of lines of symmetry for a regular pentagon.

questions.question_text: A line of symmetry divides a shape into two ________ halves.
questions.explanation_correct: A line of symmetry divides a shape into two identical halves because it splits the shape exactly in the middle, making the two sides identical or the same. This means the two halves are perfect mirror images of each other.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The wrong answer would be 'different' halves. This is incorrect because a line of symmetry divides a shape into two identical or matching halves, not different ones. The two halves created by the line of symmetry must be exactly the same, or 'identical'.

questions.question_text: Point symmetry occurs when a figure can be rotated 180° about a central point and look identical.
questions.explanation_correct: Point symmetry occurs when a figure can be rotated 180° about a central point and look identical. This means that the figure is exactly the same if you flip it over the central point.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Point symmetry is not the same as line symmetry. Line symmetry occurs when a figure can be divided into two equal halves by a line. Point symmetry is when the figure can be rotated 180° around a central point and look the same, rather than just being divided by a line.

questions.question_text: Which of the following letters has point symmetry?
questions.explanation_correct: The letter 'S' has point symmetry, which means it looks the same when rotated around a point. If you turn the letter 'S' upside down, it looks exactly the same. This is why 'S' is the correct option.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The letters 'A', 'M', and 'E' do not have point symmetry. If you turn them upside down, they look different. Only the letter 'S' has this special property of looking the same when rotated around a point, which is why it is the correct answer.

questions.question_text: What is the order of rotational symmetry of a square?
questions.explanation_correct: A square has 4 sides and 4 angles that are all equal. This means it can be rotated 90 degrees, 180 degrees, 270 degrees, or 360 degrees and still look exactly the same. This is called a rotational symmetry of order 4.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option A) 2 is incorrect because a square can be rotated in 4 different positions and still look the same. Option B) 3 is incorrect because a square does not have a rotational symmetry of order 3. Option D) 8 is incorrect because a square can only be rotated in 4 different positions and still look the same.

questions.question_text: The order of rotational symmetry of a regular hexagon is ________.
questions.explanation_correct: A regular hexagon has 6 sides and 6 vertices. When you rotate a regular hexagon, it looks exactly the same after 60 degrees, 120 degrees, 180 degrees, 240 degrees, 300 degrees, and 360 degrees. This means the order of rotational symmetry of a regular hexagon is 6.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The order of rotational symmetry of a regular hexagon is 6. This means a regular hexagon can be rotated by 60 degrees, 120 degrees, 180 degrees, 240 degrees, 300 degrees, and 360 degrees and it will look exactly the same. If you try to rotate it by 45 degrees or 90 degrees, it will not look the same, so the order of rotational symmetry is not 4.

questions.question_text: A rectangle has rotational symmetry of order 2.
questions.explanation_correct: A rectangle has rotational symmetry of order 2 because it can be rotated 180 degrees (half a full turn) and look exactly the same as the original shape.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Some students may think that a rectangle does not have rotational symmetry because it is a 4-sided shape. However, a rectangle can be rotated 180 degrees and still look the same as the original shape, which means it has rotational symmetry of order 2.

questions.question_text: What is the angle of rotation for a regular pentagon with rotational symmetry?
questions.explanation_correct: The angle of rotation for a regular pentagon is 72°. This is because a regular pentagon has 5 sides, and if we divide 360° (the total angle for a full rotation) by 5, we get 72°, which is the angle of rotation for a regular pentagon.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is B) 72°. A regular pentagon has 5 sides, and the angle of rotation for a regular polygon is 360° divided by the number of sides. So for a pentagon, the angle of rotation is 360° / 5 = 72°. The other options are incorrect because 60° is the angle for a hexagon, 90° is for a square, and 120° is for a triangle.

questions.question_text: A parallelogram (that is not a rectangle) has ________ symmetry but no line symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: A parallelogram (that is not a rectangle) has point symmetry because it can be rotated 180 degrees around its center point and it will look exactly the same. However, it does not have any line symmetry because it cannot be folded along a line to create two identical halves.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'point'. A parallelogram (that is not a rectangle) has point symmetry, meaning it can be rotated 180 degrees around its center point and it will look exactly the same. This is because the opposite sides and angles of a parallelogram are equal. However, a parallelogram does not have any line symmetry, as it cannot be folded along a line to create two identical halves.

questions.question_text: Which of the following figures has exactly 4 lines of symmetry?
questions.explanation_correct: A square has exactly 4 lines of symmetry because it has 4 sides of equal length and 4 right angles. This means you can draw 4 lines through the square that divide it into two equal halves.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A rectangle does not have exactly 4 lines of symmetry - it has only 2 lines of symmetry. A rhombus has 2 lines of symmetry. A parallelogram has no lines of symmetry. The square is the only shape among the options that has exactly 4 lines of symmetry.

questions.question_text: An equilateral triangle has rotational symmetry of order 3.
questions.explanation_correct: An equilateral triangle has rotational symmetry of order 3 because it can be rotated by 120 degrees (1/3 of a full circle) and still look exactly the same.
questions.explanation_incorrect: An equilateral triangle does not have rotational symmetry of order 2, which means it cannot be rotated by 180 degrees and still look the same. However, it does have rotational symmetry of order 3, which means it can be rotated by 120 degrees (1/3 of a full circle) and still look exactly the same.

questions.question_text: How many lines of symmetry does a regular octagon have?
questions.explanation_correct: A regular octagon has 8 sides and 8 vertices. Since it is a regular shape, it has 8 lines of symmetry - one going through each pair of opposite sides and vertices.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options do not match the number of sides and vertices of a regular octagon. A regular octagon is a polygon with 8 sides and 8 vertices, so it has 8 lines of symmetry. Options A, B, and D do not correctly identify the number of lines of symmetry for a regular octagon.

questions.question_text: The letter X has ________ lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: The letter X has 4 lines of symmetry because it can be folded in half vertically, horizontally, and diagonally in both directions. This means there are 4 lines that divide the X into two equal halves.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The letter X does not have 2 lines of symmetry. This is incorrect because the X shape can actually be folded in 4 different ways to create two equal halves, so the correct number of lines of symmetry for the letter X is 4.

questions.question_text: The letter Z has point symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: The letter Z has point symmetry because if you imagine a dot at the center of the letter, the letter looks the same when you rotate it 180 degrees around that dot.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The letter Z does not have line symmetry, where the letter is divided into two equal halves that are mirror images of each other. However, the letter Z does have point symmetry, which means that if you imagine a dot at the center of the letter, the letter looks the same when you rotate it 180 degrees around that dot.

questions.question_text: What is the order of rotational symmetry of a circle?
questions.explanation_correct: The order of rotational symmetry of a circle is infinite. This means that a circle can be rotated any number of times around its center and still look the same. This is because a circle has perfect symmetry in all directions.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is D) Infinite. A circle has infinite rotational symmetry because it can be rotated any number of times around its center and still look the same. This is because a circle has perfect symmetry in all directions. Options A, B, and C are incorrect because they represent a finite number of rotations, which would not correctly describe the symmetry of a circle.

questions.question_text: Arrange the following shapes in increasing order of their number of lines of symmetry:
questions.explanation_correct: The shapes are arranged in increasing order of their number of lines of symmetry. A scalene triangle has no lines of symmetry, an isosceles triangle has one line of symmetry, an equilateral triangle has three lines of symmetry, and a square has four lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be to arrange the shapes in decreasing order of their number of lines of symmetry. This would be: Square, Equilateral triangle, Isosceles triangle, Scalene triangle. However, this is not the correct order as the question asks to arrange them in increasing order, not decreasing order.

questions.question_text: If a shape has rotational symmetry of order 5, the angle of rotation is ________°.
questions.explanation_correct: If a shape has rotational symmetry of order 5, it means the shape can be rotated 5 times before it looks the same as the original. To find the angle of rotation, we divide 360° (the full circle) by 5, which gives us 72°.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The angle of rotation for a shape with rotational symmetry of order 5 is not 90°. This would be the case if the shape had rotational symmetry of order 4. Since the order of rotational symmetry is 5, the angle of rotation is 360° divided by 5, which is 72°.

questions.question_text: A rhombus has exactly 2 lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: A rhombus has exactly 2 lines of symmetry because it has 4 equal sides and 4 equal angles. The diagonals of a rhombus bisect each other at right angles, creating 2 lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A common misconception is that a rhombus has 4 lines of symmetry. This is not true because a rhombus only has 2 lines of symmetry, which are the diagonals that bisect each other at right angles. The other two lines that connect the opposite vertices are not lines of symmetry.

questions.question_text: Which letter of the alphabet has the most lines of symmetry?
questions.explanation_correct: The letter O has the most lines of symmetry - it has an infinite number of lines of symmetry passing through the center of the circle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The letter H has only 2 lines of symmetry - one vertical line and one horizontal line. The letter X has 2 lines of symmetry as well - one diagonal line and one other diagonal line. The letter I has only 1 line of symmetry - the vertical line down the middle. So the letter with the most lines of symmetry is the letter O.

questions.question_text: Which of the following shapes has point symmetry but no line symmetry?
questions.explanation_correct: The parallelogram (non-rectangle) has point symmetry, meaning it can be rotated around a central point and still look the same. However, it does not have any line symmetry, as it cannot be folded in half to create two identical halves.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The square has both point symmetry and line symmetry, as it can be rotated around a central point and also folded in half to create two identical halves. The isosceles triangle and the regular pentagon have line symmetry, but not point symmetry. Therefore, the correct answer is the parallelogram (non-rectangle).

questions.question_text: A regular polygon with 9 sides has rotational symmetry of order ________.
questions.explanation_correct: A regular polygon with 9 sides has rotational symmetry of order 9 because it can be rotated by 360/9 = 40 degrees and still look the same. This means it has 9 different orientations that are all identical, so the order of its rotational symmetry is 9.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 9. A regular polygon with 9 sides has 9 sides that are all equal, so it can be rotated by 40 degrees (360/9) and still look the same. This means it has 9 different orientations that are all identical, so the order of its rotational symmetry is 9, not a different number like 3 or 6.

questions.question_text: Every shape that has line symmetry must also have rotational symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: Not every shape that has line symmetry will also have rotational symmetry. Some shapes, like a rectangle or a parallelogram, have line symmetry but do not have rotational symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A shape with line symmetry does not necessarily have rotational symmetry. Line symmetry means the shape can be divided into two equal halves by a line, but rotational symmetry means the shape can be rotated by a certain angle and look the same. Some shapes, like a square, have both line and rotational symmetry, but others, like a rectangle, only have line symmetry and not rotational symmetry.

questions.question_text: A regular polygon has 12 lines of symmetry. How many sides does it have?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is D) 12 sides. A regular polygon with 12 lines of symmetry must have 12 equal sides, because each line of symmetry bisects one side of the polygon.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options are not correct because they do not match the number of lines of symmetry. A regular polygon with 6 sides would have 6 lines of symmetry, a polygon with 8 sides would have 8 lines of symmetry, and a polygon with 10 sides would have 10 lines of symmetry. Only a regular polygon with 12 sides has 12 lines of symmetry.

questions.question_text: What is the minimum angle of rotation for a regular decagon (10-sided polygon) to coincide with itself?
questions.explanation_correct: The minimum angle of rotation for a regular decagon to coincide with itself is 36°. This is because a regular decagon has 10 sides, and dividing 360° (the full rotation) by 10 gives us 36°, which is the angle needed for the decagon to match its original position.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is option B, 36°. A regular decagon has 10 sides, and the angle needed for it to coincide with itself is 360° divided by 10, which is 36°. The other options, 30°, 40°, and 45°, are not the correct minimum angle of rotation for a regular decagon.

questions.question_text: Arrange the following regular polygons in increasing order of their lines of symmetry:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order of the regular polygons in increasing order of their lines of symmetry is: Triangle, Pentagon, Hexagon, Octagon. This is because a triangle has 3 lines of symmetry, a pentagon has 5 lines, a hexagon has 6 lines, and an octagon has 8 lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be: Pentagon, Triangle, Hexagon, Octagon. This is because a pentagon has fewer lines of symmetry than a triangle. A triangle has 3 lines, while a pentagon has only 5 lines of symmetry. The correct order is Triangle, Pentagon, Hexagon, Octagon.

questions.question_text: Point symmetry is equivalent to rotational symmetry of order ________.
questions.explanation_correct: Point symmetry is equivalent to rotational symmetry of order 2 because an object with point symmetry can be rotated 180 degrees (half a full circle) and it will look the same as the original object. This is the same as the definition of rotational symmetry of order 2.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Point symmetry is not equivalent to rotational symmetry of order 1. Rotational symmetry of order 1 means the object looks the same after a 360 degree rotation, which is just the original object. Point symmetry is when an object looks the same if you flip it over a point, which is different from just rotating the object. The correct answer is 2, because point symmetry is equivalent to rotational symmetry of order 2.

questions.question_text: A regular polygon with n sides has n lines of symmetry and rotational symmetry of order n.
questions.explanation_correct: A regular polygon with n sides has n lines of symmetry and rotational symmetry of order n because each side and vertex of the polygon is identical. This means the polygon can be rotated by 360/n degrees and still look the same.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A regular polygon with n sides may not have n lines of symmetry. The number of lines of symmetry depends on the number of sides - for example, a square has 4 lines of symmetry, while a pentagon has 5 lines of symmetry. However, a regular polygon with n sides will always have rotational symmetry of order n, meaning it can be rotated by 360/n degrees and still look the same.

questions.question_text: Which of the following digits (0-9) has exactly 2 lines of symmetry?
questions.explanation_correct: The digits 0 and 8 have exactly 2 lines of symmetry, so the correct answer is D. Both 0 and 8 can be divided into two equal halves that are mirror images of each other, making them symmetric about two lines.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The digits 0 and 8 have exactly 2 lines of symmetry, while the digits 3 and 9 only have 1 line of symmetry. The digit 0 is symmetric about a vertical line and a horizontal line, and the digit 8 is symmetric about a vertical line and a horizontal line. Therefore, the correct answer is D, not B or C.

questions.question_text: If a regular polygon has an angle of rotation of 45°, it has ________ sides.
questions.explanation_correct: If a regular polygon has an angle of rotation of 45°, it means the polygon can be rotated by 45° and still look the same. This means the polygon must have 8 sides, since 360° / 45° = 8.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer format is a single number, 8. However, if the angle of rotation is 45°, the polygon would not have 8 sides. A regular polygon with an angle of rotation of 45° must have 8 sides, since 360° / 45° = 8. So the correct answer is 8 sides.

questions.question_text: Which of the following numbers has point symmetry when written?
questions.explanation_correct: The number 88 has point symmetry when written, meaning it looks the same when flipped upside down. This is because the digits 8 are symmetrical around the middle point of the number.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The numbers 69 and 96 do not have point symmetry because they look different when flipped upside down. The number 66 also does not have point symmetry, as the digits 6 are not symmetrical around the middle point. Therefore, the correct answer is option C) 88.

questions.question_text: A shape with rotational symmetry of order 1 has no rotational symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: A shape with rotational symmetry of order 1 means that it can only be rotated by 360 degrees (a full circle) and still look the same. This is the same as having no rotational symmetry at all. So a shape with rotational symmetry of order 1 has no meaningful rotational symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Some students might think that a shape with rotational symmetry of order 1 has some kind of rotational symmetry. However, this is not true. Rotational symmetry of order 1 means that the shape looks the same after a full 360 degree rotation, which is the same as having no rotational symmetry at all. The shape cannot be rotated by any smaller angle and still look the same.

questions.question_text: An isosceles trapezium (with two equal non-parallel sides) has how many lines of symmetry?
questions.explanation_correct: An isosceles trapezium has two equal non-parallel sides. This means it has one line of symmetry that passes through the midpoint of the parallel sides, dividing the shape into two equal halves. Therefore, the correct answer is B, which is 1 line of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are incorrect because 0 lines of symmetry means the shape is not symmetrical at all, 2 lines of symmetry is for a rectangle or square, and 4 lines of symmetry is for a square. An isosceles trapezium has only 1 line of symmetry that passes through the midpoint of the parallel sides.

questions.question_text: Arrange the following in increasing order of rotational symmetry:
questions.explanation_correct: The order of rotational symmetry for the given shapes is: Isosceles triangle (1), Rectangle (2), Equilateral triangle (3), and Square (4). This is because an isosceles triangle can only be rotated 180 degrees, a rectangle can be rotated 90 or 180 degrees, an equilateral triangle can be rotated 120 or 240 degrees, and a square can be rotated 90, 180, 270, or 360 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: An incorrect order would be: Isosceles triangle, Equilateral triangle, Rectangle, Square. This is wrong because a rectangle has a higher order of rotational symmetry (2) than an isosceles triangle (1), and a square has the highest order of rotational symmetry (4) compared to the other shapes.

questions.question_text: If a regular polygon has rotational symmetry of order 12, its angle of rotation is ________°.
questions.explanation_correct: If a regular polygon has rotational symmetry of order 12, it means the polygon can be rotated 12 times before it looks the same. Since a full rotation is 360°, dividing 360° by 12 gives us the angle of rotation, which is 30°.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer format is a single number, 30. If a regular polygon has rotational symmetry of order 12, it means the polygon can be rotated 12 times before it looks the same. However, the angle of rotation is not 12°, as that would be the case if the order of rotational symmetry was 30. The correct angle of rotation is 30°, obtained by dividing 360° (a full rotation) by 12 (the order of rotational symmetry).

questions.question_text: Every rectangle has point symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: Every rectangle has point symmetry because it can be divided into two equal halves that are identical to each other. This means that if you draw a point in the center of the rectangle, the entire shape will look the same if you rotate it 180 degrees around that point.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A common mistake is to think that rectangles only have line symmetry, where you can draw a line through the middle and the two halves will be identical. However, rectangles actually have both line symmetry and point symmetry. The point of symmetry is located at the center of the rectangle.

questions.question_text: A kite (quadrilateral with two pairs of adjacent equal sides) has how many lines of symmetry?
questions.explanation_correct: A kite has two pairs of equal adjacent sides, and therefore has one line of symmetry that passes through the midpoints of the opposite sides. This makes the correct answer B, which is 1 line of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options are: A) 0 lines of symmetry (a kite has 1 line), C) 2 lines of symmetry (a kite has 1 line), and D) 4 lines of symmetry (a kite has 1 line). A kite is a special quadrilateral with two pairs of equal adjacent sides, and it has exactly one line of symmetry that passes through the midpoints of the opposite sides.

questions.question_text: The order of rotational symmetry for a regular polygon is equal to the number of its ________.
questions.explanation_correct: The order of rotational symmetry for a regular polygon is equal to the number of its sides because a regular polygon has the same number of sides and angles. When you rotate the polygon by 360 degrees divided by the number of sides, it will look exactly the same as the original. This means the order of rotational symmetry is the same as the number of sides.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The order of rotational symmetry for a regular polygon is not equal to the number of its vertices or corners. The order of rotational symmetry is the number of times the polygon can be rotated by 360 degrees and still look the same. This is the same as the number of sides, not the number of vertices or corners.

questions.question_text: All shapes with point symmetry have an even order of rotational symmetry (if we count order 2 as even).
questions.explanation_correct: All shapes with point symmetry have an even order of rotational symmetry. This is because when a shape has point symmetry, it can be rotated 180 degrees (order 2) and look exactly the same as the original shape. Higher orders of rotational symmetry are also even, like 4, 6, 8, etc.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Some people may think that shapes with point symmetry can have any order of rotational symmetry, even if it's odd. But this is not true. Shapes with point symmetry must have an even order of rotational symmetry, because they need to look the same after a 180 degree rotation. Odd orders of rotation, like 3 or 5, would make the shape look different from the original.

questions.question_text: What shape is Equilateral triangle?
questions.explanation_correct: An equilateral triangle has 3 equal sides and 3 equal angles. This means it has a total of 3 lines of symmetry, one passing through each vertex and one passing through the midpoint of each side.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options do not represent the number of lines of symmetry in an equilateral triangle. Option B (6) is incorrect because an equilateral triangle has only 3 lines of symmetry. Option C (2) is incorrect because an equilateral triangle has more than 2 lines of symmetry.

questions.question_text: What shape is Regular hexagon?
questions.explanation_correct: A regular hexagon has 6 equal sides and 6 equal angles, so the correct answer is C) 6. The number of sides and angles in a regular hexagon is always 6.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A regular polygon is a shape with all sides and angles equal. A regular hexagon has 6 equal sides and 6 equal angles, so the correct answer is C) 6. The other options, A) 3 and B) 2, do not represent the number of sides or angles in a regular hexagon.

questions.question_text: What shape is Rectangle?
questions.explanation_correct: A rectangle has 2 lines of symmetry. This means it can be folded in half along 2 different lines and the two halves will match exactly. The correct answer is C) 2, since a rectangle has 2 lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The options A) 3 and B) 6 are incorrect because a rectangle does not have 3 or 6 lines of symmetry. A rectangle has 2 lines of symmetry - it can be folded along the horizontal and vertical centerlines and the two halves will match exactly.

questions.question_text: What shape is Rhombus?
questions.explanation_correct: A rhombus is a shape with 4 equal sides and 4 angles. The correct number of sides for a rhombus is 4, which matches option B.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A rhombus is not a shape with 6 sides (option A) or 3 sides (option C). These are other shapes like a hexagon and a triangle. A rhombus has 4 equal sides, so the correct number of sides is 2, which matches option B.

questions.question_text: What shape is Equilateral triangle?
questions.explanation_correct: An equilateral triangle has 3 equal sides, so the number of lines of symmetry for an equilateral triangle is 3.
questions.explanation_incorrect: An equilateral triangle is a shape with 3 equal sides. The number of lines of symmetry for an equilateral triangle is 3, not 2, 6, or 1. This is because an equilateral triangle can be folded in 3 different ways to match itself exactly, showing 3 lines of symmetry.

questions.question_text: What shape is Regular hexagon?
questions.explanation_correct: A regular hexagon has 6 equal sides and 6 equal angles, so the shape is symmetrical around 6 lines. This means a regular hexagon has a symmetry order of 6.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The options given are the different symmetry orders of shapes. A regular hexagon has 6 lines of symmetry, so the correct answer is C) 6. Other shapes like squares have 4 lines of symmetry (option C), while triangles have 3 lines of symmetry (option A).

questions.question_text: What shape is Rectangle?
questions.explanation_correct: A rectangle has 2 lines of symmetry, which means it can be divided into two equal halves along two different lines. This makes the correct answer C) 2.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A rectangle does not have 6 lines of symmetry (option A). It also does not have only 1 line of symmetry (option B) or 3 lines of symmetry (option D). The correct answer is 2 lines of symmetry, because a rectangle can be divided into two equal halves along its length and its width.

questions.question_text: What shape is Scalene triangle?
questions.explanation_correct: A scalene triangle is a triangle with all three sides of different lengths. Therefore, the correct answer is option B, which represents a scalene triangle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options do not represent shapes of triangles. Option A represents a hexagon, which has 6 sides. Option C represents a triangle with 3 sides, but it is not a scalene triangle. Option D represents a quadrilateral, which has 4 sides. Only option B correctly identifies a scalene triangle, which has all three sides of different lengths.

questions.question_text: What is the their type of symmetry: of Letter H?
questions.explanation_correct: The letter 'H' has both line symmetry and point symmetry. It has a vertical line of symmetry that goes through the middle of the letter, and a point of symmetry at the center of the letter.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The letter 'H' does not have only point symmetry or only line symmetry. It has both types of symmetry. The letter has a vertical line of symmetry that goes through the middle, and it also has a point of symmetry at the center of the letter. Therefore, the correct answer is that the letter 'H' has both line and point symmetry.

questions.question_text: What is the their type of symmetry: of Letter A?
questions.explanation_correct: The letter 'A' has line symmetry because it can be divided into two equal halves that are mirror images of each other. This means that if you fold the letter 'A' along its center, the two sides will match up exactly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The letter 'A' does not have point symmetry because it cannot be rotated around a central point and still look the same. It also does not have both line and point symmetry, as it only has line symmetry. Option B, 'No symmetry', is incorrect because the letter 'A' clearly has line symmetry.

questions.question_text: What is the their type of symmetry: of Letter S?
questions.explanation_correct: The letter S has point symmetry, meaning it can be rotated 180 degrees around its center and still look the same. This is because the S is symmetrical about a point at the center of the letter.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The letter S does not have line symmetry, as it cannot be divided into two equal halves that are mirror images of each other. It also does not have both line and point symmetry. The correct answer is that the letter S has only point symmetry.

questions.question_text: What is the their type of symmetry: of Letter F?
questions.explanation_correct: The letter F does not have any line or point symmetry, so the correct answer is C) No symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The letter F does not have line symmetry because if you draw a line through the middle of the letter, the two halves will not match. It also does not have point symmetry, because if you rotate the letter around a point, the shape will not look the same. Therefore, the letter F has no symmetry at all.
